# Markdown Lexicons

What if we could describe a lexicon in Markdown?

I think it might be a really readable way to represent them.

What do you think?

## An Example

Let's suppose we wanted to represent some thing

#### com.example.some.thing
> A description of the lexicon

|Property|Type|Description|
|-|-|-|
| **`$type`** | `string` | The type of the object.  Must be `com.example.some.object`. |
| **`name`** | `string` | The thing's name|
| `description` | `string` | A description of the thing   |
| `url` | `string` | A description of the thing   |
| `createdAt` | `datetime` |The time the challenge was created |

## But Why?

In my opinion, markdown is popular because it is easy.

I think lexicons _should_ be easy.

If you distill them to their essence, lexcions are just a name for a list of properties or parameters.

It's certainly possible to represent them in other forms
record.title: Markdown Lexicons
